News & Press

In the News

Project Night Night | Bedtime Treasures for Kids with Little of Their Own

June 26, 2014 12:34 PM

By Jennifer Saranow Schultz

When Josephine Ambrose, 22, escaped domestic violence a year ago, she left everything behind except her now 1-year-old son and 3-year-old daughter. The family has been living in shelters ever since, and the transition has been hard on the two children. However, their new “friends” might just make it a bit easier. Read more...

Kindness Crew | Project Night Night

Nov 08, 2011 10:36 PM

Kristen Remington

Do your kids have a bedtime routine? Maybe they read a story before falling asleep or have a special blanket. Unfortunately, many children cannot say they do. In fact, they do not even have the security of knowing where they are going to lay their heads at night, which is how a non-profit based in San Francisco was born. Read more...
